sect2.title: Libranet GNU/Linux Install Guide
sect2.para:
The installation guide that is available during the installation through the Help buttons is also available on an installed system (in HTML and PDF format):
/usr/share/libranet-guide/install-guide.html /usr/share/libranet-guide/install-guide.pdf

sect2.title: Linux HOWTO's
sect2.para: The famous Linux HOWTOs are a collection of documents which cover specific parts of a GNU/Linux system. Most HOWTOs are distribution independent, and therefore very useful for using them with Libranet GNU/Linux.

sect2.title: Manual pages
sect2.para: Most Unix-like commands are covered by the a traditional *nix help system called the manual pages. You can read the manual page of a program by using the man command. Executing man with the name of the command as a parameter shows the manual page for that command. For example:
If you do not know the exact name of a manual page or command, you can search a page using the keyword (-k) parameter:
sect2.screen: $ man -k routing NETLINK_ROUTE (7) - Linux IPv4 routing socket netstat (8) - Print network connections, routing tables, interface statistics, masquerade connections, and multicast memberships route (8) - show / manipulate the IP routing table rtnetlink (7) - Linux IPv4 routing socket NETLINK_ROUTE (7) - Linux IPv4 routing socket netstat (8) - Print network connections, routing tables, interface statistics, masquerade connections, and multicast memberships route (8) - show / manipulate the IP routing table rtnetlink (7) - Linux IPv4 routing socket
sect2.para: We have to add that there are also manual pages that cover other things than commands. These sections of manual pages are available:
sect2.screen: 1 Executable programs or shell commands 2 System calls (functions provided by the kernel) 3 Library calls (functions within program libraries) 4 Special files (usually found in /dev) 5 File formats and conventions eg /etc/passwd 6 Games 7 Miscellaneous (including macro packages and conven- tions), e.g. man(7), groff(7) 8 System administration commands (usually only for root) 9 Kernel routines [Non standard]

sect2.title: Libranet GNU/Linux Install Guide
sect2.para: The installation guide that was mentioned earlier in this chapter, is also available from:

sect2.title: The Libranet support solutions database
sect2.para: The Libranet support solutions database has a collection of short HOWTO's covering a wide range of topics. The Libranet support solutions database can be found at: http://libranet.com/support/

sect2.title: The Libranet forum
sect2.para: The Libranet forum is well known for its friendly and helpful community. Besides being a place for solving problems it is an excellent place to just hang out and talk about Libranet and GNU/Linux. The Libranet forum can be found at: http://forum.libranet.com/

sect2.title: The libranet-users mailinglist
sect2.para: The libranet-users mailinglist can be used to ask questions about Libranet. Information about subscribing to the list can be found on the Libranet community page at http://libranet.com/community

sect2.title: The Libranet IRC channel
sect2.para: Libranet has its own IRC channel, #libranet, which can be found on the irc.debian.org server. Fire up an IRC client, like XChat, BitchX or Epic, connect to the irc.debian.org server and enter "/join #libranet" to join the Libranet channel.
